page.title: 02BISHOPS LYDEARD SCHOOL
page.content: The school was opened on April 1st(a significant date?) in the year 1872.It was an "all-age" school until 1953 since then most of the children over 11 years have gone to Kingsmeade School in Wivelescombe.At present there are 262 children on roll in 8 classes.In 1978 the first stages of modernising the original building was begun,but this is still not finnished with 4 classes and staffrooms etc. in temporary accomadation.Of especial interest is a weather vane on the roof of the school hall,this depicts a crossing patrol lady showing children across the road,coverage on television and the national press suggests that this is the only one of its kind.The main aim of the school is summed up in part of the school prayer which asks children"to make our school a happy place for all".
